job_info.role_description: We are looking for a skilled Frontend Developer to join our team and help build intuitive, performant, and visually appealing web applications. You will work closely with designers, backend developers, and product managers to deliver seamless user experiences that align with business goals.

soft_skills: Good problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

job_responsibilities: Develop responsive, accessible, and user-friendly interfaces using modern frontend frameworks (React, Next.js, Vue, etc.).
Integrate APIs and backend services to deliver dynamic web experiences.
Collaborate with UI/UX designers to translate designs into functional components.
Optimize web applications for speed, scalability, and cross-browser compatibility.
Participate in code reviews, version control (Git), and agile development practices.
Debug, test, and maintain code to ensure high quality and reliability.
Stay updated with the latest frontend trends, libraries, and best practices.

questions.question: In a Next.js page component, which hook should you call to retrieve dynamic route parameters from the URL?
2. Which CSS feature allows you to create a responsive grid that automatically fits as many 200 px-wide columns as possible into the container?
3. You receive a 401 response from an API call in a React app. What is the most appropriate client-side action?

options.text: Retry the request with exponential backoff
Redirect the user to the login page and refresh the access token
Switch to a fallback API endpoint
Cache the response for offline use

questions.question: 4. Which of the following will best prevent XSS when rendering user-generated HTML in React?
5. Vue 3 exposes refs and reactive. What is the key difference when destructuring them?

options.text: refs are automatically unwrapped in templates; reactive loses reactivity when destructured
reactive only works for arrays, refs for objects
No difference; both stay reactive after destructuring

questions.question: 6. You need to lazy-load a React component. Which syntax is correct?
7. A Lighthouse report flags "Eliminate render-blocking resources". Which change offers the biggest win?

options.text: Defer non-critical CSS with <link rel="preload" as="style" onload="this.rel='stylesheet'">

questions.question: 8. You want to share non-visual logic between multiple Vue components. What is the recommended composition-api approach?
9. Which HTTP caching header should you set on a static Next.js asset that can never change once built?
10. React key props help reconcile lists. Which statement about keys is true?

options.text: Keys must be globally unique across the whole app
Array indices are always safe as keys
Keys should be stable, predictable, and unique among siblings
Keys are ignored in server-side rendering

questions.question: 11. You run npm audit and see 3 high-severity vulnerabilities in devDependencies. What is the safest first step?

options.text: Ignore them; they are only in devDependencies
Run npm audit fix --dry-run to review automatic fixes
Upgrade every package to latest major versions

questions.question: 12. Which statement about CSS specificity is correct?

options.text: #id selectors have higher specificity than .class selectors
Specificity is irrelevant inside Shadow DOM

questions.question: 13. You want to run a side effect only once after a React component mounts. Which useEffect dependency array should you use?
14. In TypeScript, you import a third-party module without types. Which declaration file name will the compiler automatically pick up?
15. Which Git command safely rewrites your last commit message without changing content?
